Description: Corroded copper alloy flat amuletic figure, poorly executed, in the shape of a mummiform falcon-headed (?) figure with arms folded on the chest, standing on a sort of corbel. The head wears a small solar disc with an uraeus, behind which is an penannular suspension ring.
Curator's comments: On small bronze figures, see W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 80 § 80, possibly one of the 10 "Horus" ?
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 80 § 80) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.49, p.62, p.180, pl.22)
